attributes.action: Support the British Motor and Racing Industry by helping to save the British Formula 1 Grand Prix
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The British Formula One Grand Prix has spent the majority of the decade in the spotlight with regards to its facilities and fitting in with the image created by Bernie Ecclestone and his companies Formula One Management and Formula One Administration.
Whilst the British Racing Drivers Club have continually spent considerable amounts on upgrading Silverstone to meet Mr Ecclestone’s requirements, the decision was made to move the BGP to Donington from 2010.
It has become increasingly clear that this deal has run into continued difficulties which presently leave the BGP in a very perilous position. To think the possibility of there been no BGP on the Formula One calendar would be a travesty.
I call upon the Prime Minister and the Government to get actively involved in safeguarding what is a national treasure and secure Britain’s position in the top echelon of World Motorsport.
The sight of the Union Jack’s at Silverstone is not equalled by any other country hosting a Grand Prix and this is an issue of National Pride born out of passion and heritage.
